channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9749] Custom threadpool for Coprocessor obtained HTables
item.description: Coprocessors currently can only use the default HTable constructor that takes a single thread-pool.This is overly constrictive for coprocessors that desire tighter control over their resources.
item.summary: Custom threadpool for Coprocessor obtained HTables

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: For 0.94, user coprocessor code would need to check whether the new method exists in CoprocessorEnvironment, right ?

Yes, that's true. I'd hope that you aren't creating tables all the time though, so checking via reflection shouldn't be all that big of an issue (esp when considering the amount of time that goes into setting up an HTable anyways).

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12608110/hbase-9749-trunk-v0.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7530//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7530//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7530//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-thrift.html

Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7530//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7530//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7530//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7530//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/7530//console

This message is automatically generated.

You don't want to override instead of replace here?

  • public HTableWrapper(TableName tableName, HConnection connection) throws IOException {
    + public HTableWrapper(TableName tableName, HConnection connection, ExecutorService pool)
    + throws IOException {

...especially given it is going into a point release (0.94 or 0.96).

+1

(Talked to James this morning at the Vespas' game so got some background on why you fellas need this)
What are you getting at Stack? External interface and functionality to users is the same, this way just minimizes the possible code paths.

External interface and functionality to users is the same, this way just minimizes the possible code paths

External Interface is the same? No external code – cps or whatever – will use this method that you are changing? If so, +1 on patch. Otherwise, consider override to minimize need for users to ch ange their code.
Yup, no change for users. I'll commit shortly.
